name: Lamb Moussaka
author: unknown
ingredients:
- olive oil
- 2 onions
- 2 cloves garlic, chopped
- 900g lamb mince
- 2 tbsp tomato puree
- 125ml  red wine
- 1 tsp thyme
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1 bunch of parsley chopped
- 2 aubergines
- 85g butter
- 85g flour
- 500ml milk
- 140g cheddar cheese, grated
- 1 egg yolk
- nutmeg
- salt and pepper
instructions:
- Salt and drain the aubergine for 30 minutes.
- In a deep saute pan that has a lid, fry the onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
- Add the lamb mince, and fry until browned.
- Add the puree, wine, thyme, cinnamon, parsley and salt. Cover and simmer for 35 minutes.
- Preheat the oven to 180c.
- Rinse the aubergine slices, brush with oil, and grill until browned.
- Make a roux with the butter, flour and milk. Add half the cheese, and season with nutmeg, salt and pepper.
- Layer the aubergine and lamb in a deep dish, and pour the roux on top.
- Spread the remaining cheese on top, and bake in the oven for 1 hour.
